questions.question: Which statement defines a circuit-switched connection for a session?
options: A single dedicated end-to-end route is reserved and all traffic follows it
Messages are split into independent packets with no reservation
Routers change routes on failure to keep delivery going
Shared links allow many transmissions to statistically share paths
questions.answer: A single dedicated end-to-end route is reserved and all traffic follows it

questions.question: Which description captures the main performance benefit of circuit switching?
options: Predictable throughput on a reserved path with guaranteed bandwidth
Efficient sharing of links by many transmissions
Automatic rerouting around unavailable nodes
Detection and retransmission of missing packets
questions.answer: Predictable throughput on a reserved path with guaranteed bandwidth

questions.question: What makes circuit switching vulnerable in terms of security?
options: Packet headers can be intercepted
Routes change frequently
A fixed route can be tapped if that line is compromised
The routerâ€™s table may be exposed
questions.answer: A fixed route can be tapped if that line is compromised

questions.question: Match each circuit-switching stage to its description.
A circuit-switched connection provides _____ bandwidth to the communicating parties.
Circuit switching is most applicable in situations requiring:
options: Efficient resource sharing
Variable routing and packet handling
Continuous reserved circuits
Statistical multiplexing

questions.question: Which statement defines packet switching for a message?
options: One dedicated end-to-end circuit is reserved
The message is split into packets that travel independently with no reservation
A fixed route is used to deliver packets strictly in order
Constant bandwidth is guaranteed for the stream
questions.answer: The message is split into packets that travel independently with no reservation

questions.question: Each packet _____ carries delivery information in addition to the data payload.
Which router action directly determines the next hop for a packet?
options: Consults its routing table
Reserves unimpeded bandwidth
Establishes a dedicated circuit
Terminates the connection

questions.question: Packet switching provides efficient resource use because:
options: Each packet reserves a separate line
Shared links allow multiple transmissions on common paths
Packets always follow the same route
All packets are sent in sequence
questions.answer: Shared links allow multiple transmissions on common paths

questions.question: Which statement expresses the resilience of packet switching?
options: Guaranteed bandwidth for constant-rate streams
In-order delivery by design
Packets can be forwarded along alternative routes if a link or node is unavailable
Capacity remains reserved even when idle
questions.answer: Packets can be forwarded along alternative routes if a link or node is unavailable

questions.question: At the receiver, packets are _____ into the original message because they may arrive out of order.
Which listed benefit addresses accuracy and completeness during loss?
options: Detection of missing packets and retransmission when required
Predictable uninterrupted throughput
Guaranteed bandwidth
Unimpeded exclusive capacity
questions.answer: Detection of missing packets and retransmission when required

questions.question: Which of the following is a stated drawback of packet switching?
options: It is inefficient when the connection is idle
It provides weaker real-time timing guarantees
A fixed route can be tapped, creating a security weakness
It cannot support web browsing
questions.answer: It provides weaker real-time timing guarantees

questions.question: Which element increases system complexity in packet switching?
options: Routers verifying packet order
Protocol mechanisms handling independent packets
Constant-rate data streams
Fixed line reservation
